<Text: A pre-commissioning unit (PRECOMMUNIT) or (PCU) is used by the United States Navy to describe vessels under construction prior to their official commissioning.>

Triplet:<United States Navy
1:
--------------------
Text: Pre-Commissioning Unit:  For example, prior to its commissioning, the aircraft carrier "Gerald R. Ford" (CVN-78) has been described by the Navy as "pre-commissioning unit (PCU) "Gerald R. Ford" ."
Triplets:<Pre-Commissioning Unit
2:
--------------------
Text: Pre-Commissioning Unit:  However, "PCU" is only a descriptive term and is not a prefix or a part of the ship's official name.

Triplets:<Pre-Commissioning Unit
3: their given name and hull number
